channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report E-2024010224
item.description:
Report E-2024010224

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LJS experienced a UN3266 Foam-Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner release from 3 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1.5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Citric acid solution was utilized along with absorbents to neutralize and clean the release. All impacted cardboard, absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The 12 damaged 1-gallon poly jugs of material were placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010155
item.description:
Report E-2024010155

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LJS experienced a UN3265 Scorpion EC1023H release from a 200-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 cups of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a pinhole puncture in the welding of the metal tote. The material was transferred into a new metal tote. Soda ash was utilized to neutralize the released material. All impacted absorbents, rags & PPE were then placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010201
item.description:
Report X-2024010201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the IC rollers on Bank 5. Package content cap was loosened, causing the internal leakage. DescribePack: Half of the package closure was missing, creating a hole in the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: There were no spills around the or near the package. The fiberboard box absorbed the leakage, no other cleanup method was used.
